Jack Ngai

Portfolio

About

Ever since the first computer my uncle gave me (his old Intel 286 with an EGA video card) when I was 10 years old, I have surrounded my life with computers, gadgets, home automation tech, and anything that changes the way we work and live. After spending over a decade in IT, technical writing and project management, I’m looking to tackle a new challenge as an iOS developer.

Over the last two years, I have learned the ins-and-outs of Swift, Apple’s preferred programming language for developing in iOS. I love its simplicity (no more semicolons!) but also its intricacies (tuples and generics) that makes it so versatile. When I’m not programming, I’m practicing mindfulness meditation, shooting landscape photography, and spending time with my family.

Contact Me


Location

Brooklyn, NY, USA


Social

Copyright © Jack Ngai 2017

Meme Me

This app let users select photos from their photo library or take photos with the camera on their iOS device and create memes with them by allowing placing text at the top and the bottom of each photo. The memed photos are saved and can be viewed in a collection view or a table view.

  • GitHub Link: Meme Me
  • Date: September 2016
  • Technical Features: UICollectionView, UITableView, Delegate Pattern

On The Map

An app that posts user-generated location information to a shared map, pulling the locations of fellow Nanodegree students, with custom messages about themselves or their learning experience.

  • GitHub Link: On The Map
  • Date: October 2016
  • Technical Features: REST API, Map Kit, Facebook SDK

Virtual Tourist

This app lets you see photos Flickr users shared from all around the word simply by long pressing anywhere on the map.

  • GitHub Link: Virtual Tourist
  • Date: November 2016
  • Technical Features: Core Data, REST API, Map Kit, UICollectionView

For New Yorkers

(Available in the App Store) This app was designed by a New Yorker, for fellow New Yorkers. It's main functions are a news reader (with news from NYT), a tip calculator, a Metrocard refill calculator and a steps calculator.The functions are divided by a tab bar controller. The user can switch between each function using the tab bar controller.

  • GitHub Link: For New Yorkers
  • Date: January 2016
  • Technical Features: Core Data, UIFetchedResultsController, UserDefaults
